articles.headline: A Major Lift for Fannie and Freddie
articles.snippet: The federal overseer of the mortgage financing giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac has increased their mission at a time when they were supposedly being phased out.
articles.abstract: The federal overseer of the mortgage financing giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac has increased their mission at a time when they were supposedly being phased out.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The federal overseer of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac on Tuesday announced a shift in policies intended to maintain the mortgage finance giants’ role in parts of the housing market, spur more home lending and aid distressed homeowners.

articles.headline: Small Comfort as Parents Identify Kidnapped Nigerian Girls on Video
articles.snippet: The families got their first glimpse of the schoolgirls since last month, when they were abducted by the Islamist group Boko Haram, whose leader has threatened to sell them.
articles.abstract: The families got their first glimpse of the schoolgirls since last month, when they were abducted by the Islamist group Boko Haram, whose leader has threatened to sell them.
articles.lead_paragraph: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria — When the girls appeared on the screen, parents in the small room at the government compound here dissolved into tears.

articles.headline: A Victory for Airbnb in New York
articles.snippet: The apartment-sharing service’s victory may be short-lived, as the state attorney general said he would address the court’s concerns in a new subpoena.
articles.abstract: The apartment-sharing service’s victory may be short-lived, as the state attorney general said he would address the court’s concerns in a new subpoena.
articles.lead_paragraph: Airbnb, the popular apartment-sharing service, won a legal standoff Tuesday when a state judge ruled that the company did not have to give up customer records as part of an investigation by the New York attorney general.

articles.headline: The Politics of Income Inequality
articles.snippet: The United States has come a long way over the last century. Still, it remains a strikingly similar place in a couple of important respects.
articles.abstract: The United States has come a long way over the last century. Still, it remains a strikingly similar place in a couple of important respects.
articles.lead_paragraph: The years from the late 19th and early 20th centuries were not the most egalitarian in American history. Robber barons roamed the economy, living off lavish rents generated by powerful cartels and industrial monopolies.

articles.headline: Doubts Raised About Off-Label Use of Subsys, a Strong Painkiller
articles.snippet: The drug was approved in 2012 for cancer patients, but has since become an outsize moneymaker for Insys Therapeutics and has been prescribed more widely.
articles.abstract: The drug was approved in 2012 for cancer patients, but has since become an outsize moneymaker for Insys Therapeutics and has been prescribed more widely.
articles.lead_paragraph: Almost overnight, a powerful new painkiller has become a $100 million business and a hot Wall Street story.

articles.headline: Girding for a Fight, McConnell Enlists His Wife
articles.snippet: The former labor secretary Elaine Chao will be more crucial than ever as Mitch McConnell, the Senate Republican leader, turns to face a well-funded female candidate in Kentucky.
articles.abstract: The former labor secretary Elaine Chao will be more crucial than ever as Mitch McConnell, the Senate Republican leader, turns to face a well-funded female candidate in Kentucky.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At Harvard Business School, Elaine L. Chao kept card files on her classmates, then later kept tabs on their careers. As labor secretary, she had gold-colored coins minted with her name in bas-relief and employed a “Veep”-like staff member who carried around her bag.

articles.headline: Heading Out on Its Own, Citizens Bank Faces a Tough Climate
articles.snippet: The Royal Bank of Scotland is sending Citizens Bank on its own into an industry that is struggling with low interest rates and slow loan growth.
articles.abstract: The Royal Bank of Scotland is sending Citizens Bank on its own into an industry that is struggling with low interest rates and slow loan growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: Being cast off from a struggling foreign parent company might bring on an identity crisis for some institutions. Not so for Citizens Bank, which is looking to turn its coming independence from the Royal Bank of Scotland into an opportunity to strengthen its consumer banking in the United States.

articles.headline: Former Head of Glaxo in China Is Accused of Bribery
articles.snippet: The Chinese authorities said Mark Reilly, a Briton, had ordered his subordinates to form a “massive bribery network.”
articles.abstract: The Chinese authorities said Mark Reilly, a Briton, had ordered his subordinates to form a “massive bribery network.”
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — Chinese authorities sent a strong warning to the pharmaceutical industry on Wednesday, implicating a top Western executive at GlaxoSmithKline in a long-running bribery scheme.
articles.byline: By David Barboza and Katie Thomas

articles.headline: China Targeted by Vietnamese in Fiery Riots
articles.snippet: Thousands of Vietnamese workers rampaged after China placed an oil rig in disputed waters, but most of the factories hit were owned by companies from South Korea and Taiwan.
articles.abstract: Thousands of Vietnamese workers rampaged after China placed an oil rig in disputed waters, but most of the factories hit were owned by companies from South Korea and Taiwan.
articles.lead_paragraph: BINH DUONG PROVINCE, Vietnam — Dozens of foreign-owned factories near Ho Chi Minh City lay in charred ruins early Thursday after thousands of Vietnamese workers rampaged over China’s latest efforts to control the South China Sea, this time off Vietnam’s coast.
articles.byline: By Chris Buckley, Chau Doan and Thomas Fuller

articles.headline: Citi Fires 11 More in Mexico Over Fraud
articles.snippet: Among those fired were four of the bank’s top executives in Mexico: its head of corporate banking, head institutional risk officer, head of trade finance and head of trade and treasury solutions.
articles.abstract: Among those fired were four of the bank’s top executives in Mexico: its head of corporate banking, head institutional risk officer, head of trade finance and head of trade and treasury solutions.
articles.lead_paragraph: Citigroup is moving quickly to try to put a costly fraud at its Mexican business behind it, firing an additional 11 employees, including four high-ranking executives in Mexico.
articles.byline: By Michael Corkery and Elisabeth Malkin
